citeinfo.title: Global Preindustrial, 20th Century, and RCP Greenhouse Gas Concentrations and Their Extension, 1765-2500

descript.abstract: This data set provides harmonized and consolidated anthropogenically-affected greenhouse gas concentration data sets for the pre-industrial control runs, 20th century, and the Representative Concentration Pathways (RCPs) of the Coupled Model Intercomparison Project, Phase 5 (CMIP5). The historical atmospheric concentrations as well as concentrations for the RCPs (2005-2100) and their extension to 2300 (ECPs) are provided for the following gases: CO2, CH4, N2O, all flourinated gases controlled under the Kyoto Protocol (HFCs, PFCs, and SF6), and ozone depleting substances controlled under the Montreal Protocol (CFCs, HCFCs, Halons, CCl4, CH3Br, CH3Cl). The data were used to drive the CMIP5 model runs. A description of the data is available in: Meinshausen, M., S. J. Smith, K. V. Calvin, J. S. Daniel, M. L. T. Kainuma, J.-F. Lamarque, K. Matsumoto, S. A. Montzka, S. C. B. Raper, K. Riahi, A. M. Thomson, G. J. M. Velders and D. van Vuuren. 2011. The RCP Greenhouse Gas Concentrations and their Extension from 1765 to 2300. Climatic Change (Special Issue), DOI: 10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z.

cntperp.cntorg: International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), Laxenburg, Austria

distinfo.resdesc: Meinshausen, M., S. J. Smith, K. V. Calvin, J. S. Daniel, M. L. T. Kainuma, J.-F. Lamarque, K. Matsumoto, S. A. Montzka, S. C. B. Raper, K. Riahi, A. M. Thomson, G. J. M. Velders and D. van Vuuren. 2011. The RCP Greenhouse Gas Concentrations and their Extension from 1765 to 2300. Climatic Change (Special Issue), DOI: 10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z. Data available on-line at [http://tntcat.iiasa.ac.at/RcpDb/] from the International Institute for Applied Systems Analysis (IIASA), Laxenburg, Austria.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standard for Digital Geospatial Metadata

Data_Set_Link.Label: GHG Concentrations for Preindustrial Control Runs, 1765-1850
20th Century Midyear GHG Concentrations for Pre-2005 Simulations, 1765-2005
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: These 2 compressed (zip) files contain global annual mean mixing ratios for atmospheric CO2 concentrations, atmospheric CH4 concentrations, atmospheric N2O concentrations, all flourinated gases controlled under the Kyoto Protocol, i.e. HFCs, PFCs, and SF6 expressed as HFC134a equivalence concentrations, all flourinated gases controlled under the Montreal Protocol, i.e. CFCs, HCFCs, Halons, CCl4, CH3Br, CH3Cl expressed as CFC-12 equivalence concentrations, flourinated gases controlled under the Kyoto Protocol, and ozone depleting substances controlled under the Montreal Protocol. Once unzipped, the data files are available in ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats.

Data_Set_Link.Label: RCP 2.6 (ECP 2.6) Midyear GHG Concentrations, 1765-2500
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This data set provides low RCP global annual mean mixing ratios for the GHG species listed in the first Note above. The data rise to peak and then decline (2005-2500). Once unzipped, the data files are available in ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats.

Data_Set_Link.Label: RCP 4.5 (ECP 4.5) Midyear GHG Concentrations, 1765-2500
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This data set provides medium-low RCP global annual mean mixing ratios for the GHG species listed in the first Note above. The data show stabilization from 2150 onwards (2005-2500). The data files are available in ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats.

Data_Set_Link.Label: RCP 6.0 (ECP 6.0) Midyear GHG Concentrations, 1765-2500
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This data set provides medium-high RCP global annual mean mixing ratios for the GHG species listed in the first Note above. The data show stabilization from 2150 onwards (2005-2500). Once unzipped, the data files are available in ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats.

Data_Set_Link.Label: RCP 8.5 (ECP 8.5) Midyear GHG Concentrations, 1765-2500
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This data set provides high RCP global annual mean mixing ratios for the GHG species listed in the first Note above. The data show stabilizing emissions post-2100 and stabilizing concentrations post-2200 (2005-2500). Once unzipped, the data files are available in ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats.

Data_Set_Link.Label: Supplemental Extension for RCP 6.0 (SCP6to4.5)
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: This data set provides supplemental extension for RCP 6.0 (SCP6to4.5). The data first represent RCP6 up to 2100, then transition towards RCP4.5, sharing the same concentrations as the RCP 4.5 extension after 2250.

Thomson, G. J. M. Velders and D. van Vuuren. 2011. The RCP Greenhouse Gas Concentrations and their Extension from 1765 to 2300. Climatic Change (Special Issue), DOI: 10.1007/s10584-011-0156-z. Data available online at [http://www.pik-potsdam.de/~mmalte/rcps/] from Potsdam Institute for Climate Impact Research (PIK), Potsdam, Germany

Data_Set_Link.Label: Historical Data, RCPs and Standard Extensions
Data_Set_Link.Link_Note: These data files are identical to the ones provided by IIASA only they are uncompressed [ASCII (.dat) and Excel (.xls) formats]. Also provided are citations for the data sources.
